Corporate Mandate #001

Issued by Gerald P. Featherton III on the occasion of his second office renovation

The Problem

Prose Is Violence

Studies (conducted by us, in our break room, sample size: Gerald) confirm that unrhymed workplace communication causes 97.3% of all HR complaints. When someone says "per my last email," it stings. When they say "per my last note, I'd like to quote," it heals.

The Solution

SquawkSpeak‚Ñ¢

A fully compliant corporate language where every official communication ‚Äî emails, Slack messages, performance reviews, termination notices ‚Äî must rhyme. AABB scheme minimum. ABAB for executive memos. Limericks reserved for C-suite only.

The Wifi Situation

Dance-Authenticated Network Access

After the Great Password Leak of 2021 (someone's parrot repeated it at a conference), we switched to motion-sensor routers. The wifi password is now a choreographed dance performed within 3 feet of the router. Changed bi-weekly. Currently: The Funky Cockatoo.

Founder's Letter ‚Äî Updated January 2026

To Those Who Say a Parrot Cannot Run HR:

My name is Gerald P. Featherton III. I am a Blue-and-Gold Macaw. I have an MBA from the Petco on 5th Avenue (they had a promotional event and I attended every session). I was the Head of Human Resources at Deloitte for eleven days before they discovered I was, in their words, "a bird."

They said I repeated everything anyone told me. They said I couldn't sign documents. They said I ate the onboarding paperwork. All of this is true. But what they failed to notice was that during my eleven days, workplace complaints dropped to zero. Why? Because I made everyone rhyme.

The termination meeting was ironic. They didn't rhyme once.

I founded Polly & Associates the next morning from a perch in my owner's apartment. (I have since purchased the apartment. My owner now rents from me. He does not enjoy this arrangement. His lease renewal was a sonnet.)

"If you can't say it with a rhyme, don't waste Gerald's precious time."

Official SquawkSpeak‚Ñ¢ corporate vocabulary. All employees must memorize by Day 3 or forfeit their seed allowance.

Meeting ‚Üí Greeting
"We shall convene a greeting" (not "meeting")
Usage: "Your 3pm greeting has been moved to the feeding room."
Deadline ‚Üí Fine Line
"The fine line approaches" (not "deadline")
Usage: "This fine line is mine; deliver on time or pay the fine."
Fired ‚Üí Admired (Elsewhere)
"You will be admired elsewhere" (not "fired")
Usage: "Karen, your talents will be admired elsewhere, which is to say, not here."
Salary ‚Üí Gallery
"Your gallery has been adjusted" (not "salary")
Usage: "Due to budget, your gallery now hangs in a smaller hall."
Complaint ‚Üí Restraint
"I wish to file a restraint" (not "complaint")
Usage: "This restraint pertains to Dave's use of free verse in the group chat."
Promotion ‚Üí Devotion
"You've earned a devotion" (not "promotion")
Usage: "Your devotion comes with a motion to a bigger cage ‚Äî sorry, office."

Current Wifi Dance ‚Äî Effective Feb 1, 2026

The Funky Cockatoo

STEP 1

Stand within 3 feet of the router. Sprout must be able to see your face. Do not wear hats.

STEP 2

Raise both arms to shoulder height. Extend fingers. This is "wing position." If you are Dave, try harder ‚Äî your last attempt was described by Sprout as "concerning."

STEP 3

Bob your head forward and back exactly 3 times in rhythm with the router's LED blinks. The blinks occur every 1.7 seconds. Do not blink at 1.8 seconds. Sprout can tell.

STEP 4

Rotate 90¬∞ clockwise while softly saying "SquawkSpeak‚Ñ¢" (the ‚Ñ¢ is silent but emotionally necessary). If the router's green light activates, you have wifi. If not, Sprout has judged you unworthy. There is no appeal process.
